title: CSS Basics
description: Learn the fundamental concepts of CSS styling

lessons.title: Introduction to Selectors
lessons.description: Selectors are patterns used to select HTML elements you want to style. In this lesson, you'll learn how to target elements with CSS.
lessons.task: Style the paragraph element by making its text color blue. Use the 'color' property with the value 'blue'.
lessons.previewHTML:
This paragraph needs to be blue!

This paragraph should remain unchanged.

validations.message: Make sure to use the '.target' class selector

lessons.title: Box Model Basics
lessons.description: The CSS box model is a fundamental concept that describes how elements are sized and spaced on a page.
lessons.task: Add padding of 1.25rem and a 0.125rem solid border with color #333 to the box element.
lessons.previewHTML: This box needs padding and a border!
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, sans-serif; padding: 1.25rem; } .box { background-color: #f0f0f0; }

lessons.title: Colors and Backgrounds
lessons.description: Learn how to apply background colors and control text coloring in different ways.
lessons.task: Style the element with a background color of #e0f7fa and text color of #01579b.
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, sans-serif; padding: 1.25rem; } .colorbox { padding: 1.5rem; text-align: center; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.125rem; }
lessons.codePrefix: /* Style the colorbox with background and text colors */

lessons.title: Typography Basics
lessons.description: Learn how to control text appearance with CSS typography properties.
lessons.task: Style the heading with font-family 'Georgia, serif', font-size of 1.5rem, and add text-shadow of 0.0625rem 0.0625rem 0.125rem #aaa.

lessons.title: CSS Units and Variables
lessons.description: Learn about different CSS units like rem, percentages, em, and how to use CSS variables (custom properties).
lessons.task: Set the width of the box to 80%, the max-width to 37.5rem, and create a CSS variable --main-color with the value #6200ee, then use it for the border color.
lessons.previewHTML: This box needs sizing with different units and a border using a CSS variable.
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, sans-serif; padding: 1.25rem; } .units-box { background-color: #f5f5f5; padding: 1rem; border: 0.125rem solid #ddd; }

validations.message: Use the CSS variable with var(--main-color)
